an8.38:1.1: “Mendicants, a good person is born in a family for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of the people.
an8.38:1.2: For the benefit, welfare, and happiness of mother and father; children and partners; bondservants, workers, and staff; friends and colleagues; departed ancestors; the king; the deities; and ascetics and brahmins.
an8.38:2.1: It’s like a great rain cloud, which nourishes all the crops for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of the people.
an8.38:2.2: In the same way, a good person is born in a family for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of the people. …
an8.38:3.1: A wise person living at home
an8.38:3.3: Neither by day or at night do they neglect
an8.38:4.1: They venerate them in accord with the teaching,
an8.38:4.3: One of settled faith and good nature
an8.38:5.3: Good for the king, good for the gods,
an8.38:5.4: and good for relatives and friends.
an8.38:6.1: In fact, they’re good for everyone,
an8.38:6.2: well grounded in the true teaching.
an8.38:6.3: Rid of the stain of stinginess,
an8.38:6.4: they’ll enjoy a world of grace.”
